title: TheGhostMan
author: TheGhostMan
content: I just came across some somewhat peculiar news and that is that the well-known actor Tom Cruise, famous for his starring role in "Mission Impossible", brings us a new action... let's say an action related to our current times that is nothing more and nothing less than cryptocurrencies and the cutting edge of artificial intelligence.QuoteMission Impossible (Dead Reckoning Part One), one of the most anticipated movies of 2023, promises to be an exciting crossover of trends, exploring two of the most prominent themes of recent years: cryptocurrency and artificial intelligence.Figure: Tom cruise mission Impossible 7.Funet:https://diario.mx/espectaculos/lucha-tom-cruise-contra-la-ia-en-mision-imposible-7-20230709-2074477.html                    This film that relates to new technologies, I think it has the opportunity to change the way people see and use cryptocurrencies in general. Honestly, I don't know in what context these issues are related in the film, whether in a positive or negative way, since I haven't had the joy of seeing it yet. but what I do know and I am sure is that without a doubt The entertainment industry and the film industry are extremely influential and have a wide audience. and whatever the context, the film could arouse the interest and curiosity of viewers in these technologies (cryptocurrency and AI) in a fun and accessible context.but more than that I think that this film could break with some stigmas and negative perceptions that surround cryptocurrencies, presenting them as something exciting and full of possibilities. It could foster a more open mind towards these technologies and allay the fear or uncertainty that some people may have due to a lack of understanding. Personally, I don't know what you guys think, but I find it intriguing that they're producing movies related to this field on the big screen. What is your opinion about it?Funet: https://criptotendencia.com/2023/07/13/mision-imposible-tom-cruise-se-enfrenta-a-la-inteligencia-artificial-y-a-las-criptomonedas-2/

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: If this film mentioned Bitcoin then we could add them here: [Collection Thread] Series and films in which Bitcoin (or Altcoins) appear.But regardless if it will break stigmas and negative perception about crypto, for me it doesn't matter. And FUD and negative things won't simply go away just because of some movies. It's better to accept that we will have critics and detractors in our market. And the sooner that we welcome that, the better for us. And for sure, majority of us are not affected by the dissenting opinions of others.

The context that is being put to it defines just how the audience would perceive the innovation.Tom Cruise is a great actor, one of the best and have stared in key roles in several box office movies and this is another big one but, I do hope it carries the right notion about cryptocurrency. comments.author: 20kevin20
comments.body: It’s nice, but I think it’s double-edge for now. Don’t celebrate too early as they say, right? We don’t know yet what light they’re gonna put crypto in. comments.body: Crypto is somewhat different from bitcoin because the movie may be all about shitcoin which will ultimately not have any significant impact on crypto adoption but if it is focused on bitcoin then we must say that the movie will be a blast and somewhat promote the cutting edge technology that has been suitable for over a decade. comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I haven't seen the movie yet, and the articles are very vague about cryptos (perhaps because it's a new movie, perhaps to avoid spoilers). It won't be anything new if this movie mentions Bitcoin or cryptos in general, as many others have already done that, but it's a very major blockbuster, so unless it's a negative mention (cryptos being used by the bad guys), it's still great publicity. I think I've watched all the previous Mission Impossible movies, so I'll most likely watch this one as well. I'm interested in how much is about cryptos there, and what sort of perception of cryptos it puts forth.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: Am yet to see the movie, but am hoping cryptocurrencies and AI is well presented that a growing toddler can easily understand it. Some old movies had depicted the reign of robots, and we got scared when we started seeing robots replace jobs. I believe this movie wouldn't portray AI and cryptocurrency in a way that would cause panic, but the reality is that advancement in the crypto and AI field has opened opportunities for new job creation, specialization and as a source of income. Unless one upgrades their skillset and knowledge of cryptocurrency, the possibility of earning in the nearest future may be slimmer than now when interest rates and charges are doubling up.This movie could also help push countries to adopt cryptocurrencies as a legal tender without strict regulators clamping down on the exchanges or crypto holders.

Because there are many other movies too exist which had showed the use of Cryptocurrency like in the latest film Fast&Furious 10 where i watched a short clip in which they talked about crypto but only for 1 or 2 second and they said, it in a way which would create a bad image in front of those who are new to crypto.Overall, i am excited for such news and hoping that such acts will being respect and will build trust among newcomers.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: I just came across what's going to become a huge phenomenon on Youtube (pretty sure):  AI-generated vocals by dead rock stars.  It absolutely blew my mind when I stumbled upon a bunch of these new songs being sung by Kurt Cobain and Layne Staley, lead singers of Nirvana and Alice in Chains, respectively.  Not going to bother linking to them, since they're probably before the time of many of you here, but that's the first example of something incredible that AI can do.Admittedly, some of the songs were kind of not well done, but I'd imagine as AI improves you wouldn't even notice a difference between an AI-generated song vs. one sung by the great Layne Staley himself.Anyway, that might have been just a wee bit off-topic, but I thought I'd share my thoughts on an AI-related subject.  I'm still of the opinion that we're all going to be screwed because of it, but I'm going to enjoy a few of its more interesting aspects while we're all still above ground, not having to hide from Skynet drones.
